info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern McDowell, Rutherford, Transylvania, Henderson, Polk, east central Jackson, southeastern Buncombe, northwestern Cleveland, northwestern Greenville and north central Pickens Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles north of Forest City to 13 miles northeast of Hendersonville to 11 miles west of Brevard. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Forest City, Brevard, Rutherfordton, Columbus, Mills River, Fletcher, Spindale, Flat Rock and Etowah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
